thread.title: UH men’s golf in sixth at Shoal Creek Invitational
thread.title_full: UH men’s golf in sixth at Shoal Creek Invitational

author: From our community
title: UH men’s golf in sixth at Shoal Creek Invitational
text:
UH men’s golf in sixth at Shoal Creek Invitational From our community   
University of Houston junior Matt Scobie posted a score of 1-under-par 143 to finish the first day of the Shoal Creek Invitational presented by Graeme McDowell in a tie for fourth place on Monday evening. 
Competing on the 7,154-yard, par-72 course at Shoal Creek Country Club, Scobie opened the two-day, 54-hole event with a 71 and added a 72 in the afternoon session. Starting on No. 13, the Ajax, Ontario, Canada, native began his day with six straights pars before sinking his first birdie on No. 1. Advertisement 
After five more pars, he suffered his first bogey but recovered to make birdie on the 447-yard, par-4 12th hole to cap his First Round with a 71. He joined with sophomore Michael Perras as the Cougars’ low round of the day. 
In the afternoon, Scobie started his round with back-to-back bogeys before draining a birdie on the par-5, 17th hole. He followed with five straight pars before evening his scorecard with a birdie on the par-3, 5th hole. He dropped back to +1 in the round with a bogey two holes later but made birdie on the par-5, 11th hole for an even-par 72. 
As a team, the Cougars stood in a tie for 6th with Mississippi with a score of 587. Houston held the First-Round lead after firing an even-par 288 but fell back with a 299 in the afternoon. 
Host UAB held the first-day lead day at 575 to finish seven strokes ahead of South Carolina, North Florida and College of Charleston, GRU Augusta was in fifth at 584. 
Perras, who captured the HBU Husky Intercollegiate individual title for the first of his career, was tied for 17th at 146, while senior Blair Hamilton was tied for 27th at 149. Senior Vincent Martino was tied for 42nd at 152 with sophomore Alan De Bondt tying for 52nd at 154. Playing as an individual, junior Emmett Oh was tied for 21st at 147, thanks to a Second Round 72. 
UAB teammates Lee Hodges stood atop the individual leaderboard after the first 36 holes with a score of 140. Teammate Taylor Eyster was in second at 141 with North Florida’s Austin Padova in third at 142. Scobie joined South Carolina’s Matthew NeSmith, GRU Augusta’s Robin Petersson and Nick Tremps of College of Charleston in a tie for fourth at 143.
